metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3247 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In PHP versions 8.0.* before 8.0.29, 8.1.* before 8.1.20, 8.2.* before8.2.7 when using SOAP HTTP Digest Authentication, random value generatorwas not checked for failure, and was using narrower range of values than itshould have. In case of random generator failure, it could lead to adisclosure of 31 bits of uninitialized memory from the client to theserver, and it also made easier to a malicious server to guess the client'snonce.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3247` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.13
libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.13
libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.13
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.13

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1ubuntu2.13').
